summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackGently remove makeup, dirt, & oil from sensitive skin. Neutrogena Hydro Boost Micellar Water features a unique all-in-one formula infused with hydrating hyaluronic acid & three types of micellar molecules.
details: DetailsBenefitsMicellar water cleanser boosts hydration & gently removes makeup, dirt, & oil from sensitive skinLiquid cleanser features a unique, all-in-one formula that cleanses skin without harsh tuggingKey IngredientsHydrating makeup remover is infused with hyaluronic acid and leaves skin hydrated for 24 hoursCleanser also contains three different types of micellar molecules to draw out dirt & oilFormulated WithoutAlcoholParabensPhthalatesSulfatesItem 2625707How To UseApply with a cotton pad over face and eyes. No need to rinse.Precautions: For external use only. Keep out of reach of children. Protect from freezing.IngredientsWater, PEG-6 Caprylic/Capric Glycerides, Polysorbate 20, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, PEG-8, Poloxamer 407, Citric Acid, Disodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Fragrance.
how_to_use: Apply with a cotton pad over face and eyes. No need to rinse.Precautions: For external use only. Keep out of reach of children. Protect from freezing.

reviews.headline: tried this on accident and i'm obsessed
reviews.comments: my makeup artist accidentally left this at my house, she said i could have it so i've been using this in place of the blue garnier micellar water to remove my makeup - this works so much better for me and is much more efficient at removing dirt and makeup! i saw other people mention that it burns their eyes or the fragrance being harsh but i don't have those issues with the product. i would purchase this one over the garnier micellar water going forward, it leaves ur skin looking so clean and hydrated

reviews.headline: It's ok
reviews.comments: I don't have sensitive skin or eyes but this one burns my eyes. I prefer garnier better.

reviews.headline: Fantastic micellar water
reviews.comments: To preface this, I have combination-oily, acne-prone, sensitive skin, with redness. I purchased this because I absolutely adore the hydro boost gel cleanser. This is probably the best micellar water I've ever used BUT, I'm quite sensitive to smells (especially if I don't like them) and the typical hyrdo boost scent does not work well with this product. The smell also lingers for longer than I expected. If the smell doesn't bother you, I highly recommend this product. It left my face feeling so clean and soft, it's not stripping at all and there is no residue left/shine like I occasionally get with other brands of micellar water. Personally, I will likely not buy another bottle until there is a fragrance free version.

reviews.headline: Love this!
reviews.comments: Great product for removing eye makeup. Love the smell of it.

reviews.headline: Heard good things
reviews.comments: Ive heard good things about this line of products, and i was out of my usual micellar water so I decides to try it out. I have sensitive aging skin so I have to be careful about what kinds of products i use.  Immediately, i noticed a strong smell when i opened and the fragrance was overwhelming on my face. The added parfum is totally unnecessary and dried my skin out. Idk why there needs to be a fragrance at all, but I will be hate panning this before returning to my usual.

reviews.headline: Dont believe the sweepstake reviews
reviews.comments: They be lying ðŸ˜­ this didnt remove much make up especially waterproof mascara tho it does not claim to lol. It does smell pretty good but maybe the fragrance burned my eyes. My skin did feel soft. Idk ill stick to the Garnier brand until i find something better.

reviews.headline: so hydrating
reviews.comments: I love this, new Holy grail. this removes all my makeup and leaves it feeling so soft and smooth. very hydrated.

reviews.headline: be careful if you have sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I used this product once and my entire face got these painful red bumps and my left eye got swollen. please be careful

media.headline: Amazing hydrating properties...
media.caption: Neutrogena Triple Hydro Boost Micellar Water

faceoff_positive.comments:
I typically don't use drugstore skincare, with Neutrogena's Hydro Boost line being one of the exceptions. This Neutrogena Hydro Boost Triple Micellar Water was gifted to my by Home Tester Club and Neutrogena in exchange for my honest review. I was honestly super excited, as I needed a new Micellar water and know I already have loved so many products in the Hydro Boost line. 

This micellar water couldn't have arrived at a better time! I literally just used up the last of the one I had. Neutrogena Hydro Boost Micellar Water has a unique formula infused with hyaluronic acid and three types of micellar molecules that work in synergy to remove make-up, stubborn waterproof mascara and help draw out dirt and oil, while boosting hydration. 

I really love how big this bottle is! It is huge compared to my usual micellar water. My skin does great with this Micellar water, it is non irritating and does an amazing job removing makeup and impurities, my skin feeling refreshed and hydrated.
faceoff_positive.headline: Love Neutrogena Hydro Boost Line!

faceoff_negative.comments: Is this micellar water effective? Yes. Is it gentle? Yes. Is it hydrating? Yes. It's a shame then that it has so much fragrance in it. I typically only use micellar water around my eyes, so putting this highly scented product there puts me off using it. I have noticed a little stinging in my eyes but I'm not sure if it's the fragrance specifically. It's weird that they put scent in this considering my other micellar waters already smell like nothing. This one smells like it had a bad scent already and they tried adding a "fresh" scent to cover it up, but instead they both come through.
faceoff_negative.headline: The fragrance ruins it
